recipes.title: Chai Exfoliating Face Scrub
instructions: In a small glass bowl, mix together all ingredients until well-combined.
Store in a small tightly-capped glass jar for up to 6 months.
To use, wet your skin. Scoop out a small amount of sugar scrub and gently rub into the skin in a circular motion to exfoliate. Rinse well.

recipes.title: Egg Substitutes
recipes.notes: Can also use 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce or 1/4 cup mashed banana.
instructions: Place the gelatin and hot water in a small glass bowl.
Blend together until it becomes frothy, about 30 seconds. Add immediately to your baking recipe.

recipes.title: Grain-Free All-Purpose Flour
instructions: Combine and mix all ingredients.
Store in an airtight canning jar in the fridge. Use to substitute regular flour in any recipe.

recipes.title: Grain-Free Baking Powder
instructions: Combine and mix all ingredients.
Store in an airtight canning jar in the fridge.

recipes.title: Homemade Citrus Cleaner
recipes.notes: Do not use vinegar solutions to clean granite, marble or stone.
instructions: Peel the lemons and place into a large glass jar with a lid.
Pour the entire bottle of vinegar over the top of the lemon peels.
Screw on the lid and let sit for 2-4 weeks.
Strain the liquid into a storage container. This is your concentrate. When ready to use, dilute with half vinegar solution and half water into a spray bottle.

recipes.title: Natural Powder Blush
recipes.notes: The amounts of each ingredient to use will vary per person. You will have to experiment to find out what works for you.
instructions: Start with 1 tsp arrowroot in a small 4 oz mason jar.
Add cocoa powder and hibiscus until you reach desired shade.
Measure each time you are adding something so once you find the perfect shade you can reproduce it easily.
Store in the 4 oz mason jar with a lid and apply with a blush brush.

recipes.title: Paleo Sandwich Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and line a 4” x 8” loaf pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine all dry ingredients and set aside.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and egg whites, milk, vinegar and coconut oil.
Immediately stir the dry mixture into the wet mixture, stirring until moistened, but do not overmix.
Transfer the batter into the loaf pan and spread out evenly.
Bake for 60 minutes or until loaf has risen and top is a deep golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack for about 30 minutes, then remove from the pan by holding the sides of the parchment paper and continue to cool on the rack until fully cooled.
Slice as desired and store tightly in the fridge for up to 4 days. Bread can also be frozen.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Seeds
instructions: Remove and wash seeds.
Pat dry.
Mix with melted coconut oil.
Spread flat on a cookie sheet on unbleached parchment paper.
Bake at 275 degrees for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Strawberry Freezer Jam
recipes.notes: Recipe yields 6 half-pint jars.
ingredients: Pomona's Universal Low Sweetener Pectin (2 tsp pectin powder and 2 tsp calcium water)
instructions: Before beginning, make calcium water:  Mix 1/2 tsp calcium powder (smaller packet in Pamona's box) with 1/2 cup water in a jar with a lid.
Wash strawberries and cut off tops.
Rinse jars and fill with hot water.  Set aside.
Pulse blend the strawberries in the blender until it reaches desired consistency.
Pour strawberry puree into the saucepan, add 2 tsp calcium water, and stir.
Measure sugar into a separate bowl. Add 2 tsp pectin powder and thoroughly stir. Turn the saucepan burner up to med/high.
Bring strawberry puree to a boil, while stirring. Add sugar/pectin mixture and a dab of coconut oil and stir vigorously for 2 minutes to dissolve pectin. Return to a boil and remove from heat.
Pour water out of jars. Use a funnel to fill jars to 1/4 inches from the top.
Keep jars on the counter until they reach room temperature. Screw lids onto the jars, then freeze until ready to use. After removing from the freezer, store in the refrigerator.

recipes.title: Taco Seasoning
instructions: Combine and mix all ingredients.
Store in a small Mason jar with a lid.

recipes.title: No-Bake Almond Butter Bars
instructions: Melt the coconut oil in the oven while starting on other ingredients.
In a medium bowl, blend almond butter, coconut butter, honey, shredded coconut, cocoa powder and coconut oil until well blended.
Press mixture into a parchment paper lined 8" by 8" baking dish and refrigerate until firm.
Meanwhile, melt the dark chocolate in a double boiler over simmering water.  Spread the melted chocolate over the bars and sprinkle with chopped almonds quickly before the chocolate hardens.
Remove parchment paper from the baking dish and cut into bars.
Keep refrigerated until ready to eat, or freeze for later use.

recipes.title: Almond Butter Cups
ingredients: TODO: figure out 2 sections of ingredients
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together all shell ingredients.

Place paper liners in a 24 mini-muffin baking tin, or a 12 regular muffin tin. Spoon a 1/8-inch layer of the shell mixture in the bottom of each muffin liner. Place the tray in the freezer to solidify.
While waiting, place the filling ingredients into a small mixing bowl and combine well. Transfer mixture to a small ziplock bag or pastry bag. Snip a tiny corner off the bag with scissors.

Take the shells out of the freezer. Pipe a small amount of the filling into the center of each muffin liner, leaving the edges visible. Add the remaining shell mixture to each muffin tin until filling is covered.
Place the tray back in the freezer to set. Serve cold or room temperature.

recipes.title: Almond Shortbread Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.  Place coconut oil in a glass dish in the oven to melt.  In a small bowl, combine almond flour, coconut flour, arrowroot starch and sea salt.
In a medium sized bowl, blend the coconut sugar, maple syrup and almond extract until combined.
Add the contents of the small bowl to the medium sized bowl and mix.  Slowly add the coconut oil and blend well.

Place dough on a sheet of parchment paper and press until it is about ½ inch thickness.  Use a cookie cutter to cut out shapes.  Place the cut cookies on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Re-roll excess dough and cut more.
Bake for 14 min. or until cookies are golden brown.  Let them cool completely on a wire rack.
Store in an airtight container until ready to eat, or freeze.

recipes.title: Baked Custard
recipes.notes: This recipe is single serve. Multiply for more servings.
ingredients: 1/4 cup - Roughly Chopped Fresh Berries (strawberry or raspberry, or a mix)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.  Use a paper towel to wipe the inside of the jar with coconut oil.
Bring a kettle of water to a boil.
In a medium bowl, whisk egg, milk, honey and vanilla.  Pour into a jar.
Transfer the jar to a casserole dish and fill the dish with just enough boiling water to go about halfway up the sides of the jar.
Bake until set, about 20 min.  Remove from the oven and water bath and set aside until cooled to room temp.
Meanwhile, in a glass dish, combine berries and lime juice.  Spread over custard and top with mint.  Cover with lid and refrigerate.

recipes.title: Banana Chia Pudding
instructions: Mash the bananas with a fork in a medium bowl.
Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into single serving size bowls, cover, and place in the fridge for at least 4 hours or overnight.

recipes.title: Banana Coconut Saute
recipes.notes: This recipe is simple but surprisingly delicious!
instructions: Preheat a skillet to medium/low with coconut oil.
Slice the bananas in half lengthwise. Place the bananas in the skillet. After a minute or two, flip the bananas for another minute and sprinkle them with coconut flakes.

recipes.title: Banana Cream Pudding Pie
recipes.notes: These can also be made in individual size serving dishes as shown above.
instructions: Place all crust ingredients in a blender and pulse, scraping down the sides, until well mixed. Press into the bottom of a pie pan.

For filling, combine sugar, arrowroot flour and coconut milk in a saucepan. Mix well and heat on medium-high, stirring continuously until thickened and bubbly. Stir for one minute more, then remove from heat.
Place the grass fed beef gelatin in a small bowl, add hot water and stir until completely dissolved. Pour the mixture into the saucepan and stir well.
Stir in the coconut oil and vanilla and mix well.
Slice the bananas and place on top of the pie crust, arranging them in a flat layer.
Pour the filling mixture on top of the bananas. Cover and place in the fridge to set for at least 3 hours.

recipes.title: Berry Custard Pie
ingredients: 13.5 ozs. Full Fat Coconut Milk (or Coconut Cream)
2 cups - Fresh (or Frozen) Berries (Blackberries, Blueberries, Strawberries, or a Mix)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a pie pan with coconut oil.
Mix coconut flour and salt in a small bowl.
In a large bowl, whisk together coconut milk, eggs, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix until smooth. Pour into the greased pan.
Sprinkle berries over the top of the batter.
Bake for 45 min. (Add 10 minutes to bake time if using frozen berries).
Allow to cool before serving.

recipes.title: Blueberry Crumble
recipes.notes: Keeps well in the fridge and is delicious served cold.
ingredients: 4 cups - Fresh or Frozen Blueberries (or other Berries)- Sometimes we throw in some peach slices or strawberries!
3 Tbsp - Avocado Oil or Coconut Oil, Melted
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Place the berries in an 8” x 8” glass dish and sprinkle with cinnamon if desired.
In a medium bowl, combine almond flour, coconut flour, tapioca or arrowroot, maple syrup and oil and mix until crumbly.
Sprinkle the topping mix over the berries.
Bake covered for 35 minutes, then remove cover and bake for another 20 minutes. Easy and Delish!

recipes.title: Caramel Date Bars
instructions: Soak the macadamia nuts in water for an hour, then rinse.
Put crust ingredients into a blender and pulse until crumbly. Pour into an 8”x8” parchment paper lined glass dish and press firmly to form a crust. Place in the freezer while continuing to work.

To prepare the caramel layer, put all caramel layer ingredients into the blender and blend until smooth, scraping down the sides as you go. Pour on top of the crust, spread evenly,  and return to the freezer to set.
Wait 20 minutes for it to become firm in the freezer.

For the top layer, mix the top layer ingredients in a saucepan on low heat and stir until combined and smooth (like chocolate sauce). Spread it with a spoon on top of the caramel layer and return it to the freezer for an hour to set.
Remove from the freezer and lift the parchment paper to remove from the glass dish. Slice into squares and store in the fridge.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake Bites
instructions: First make the frosting. Soak the macadamia nuts in water for 3 hours or overnight. Rinse with cold water and drain well.

In a blender/food processor, combine all the frosting ingredients and blend on low. Slowly increase speed until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed. Pour into a bowl, cover and refrigerate while you make the bites.
For the bites: Pulse all bite ingredients except the carrots in a blender until it becomes uniform throughout. Move mixture to a medium bowl and fold in the shredded carrots by hand. Combine well.
Line a 12 mini muffin pan with paper liners. Fill each muffin cup almost to the top and press to flatten. Use a spoon to dollop the frosting onto the top of each muffin cup.
Chill in the fridge for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Caveman Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Combine almond flour, baking soda and salt.
In a separate bowl, cream together almond butter, syrup, egg and vanilla.
Add almond flour and mix gradually, then fold in chocolate chips.
Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Scoop dough onto cookie sheet 1” apart.
Bake for 10 min or until set.
Cool 2 min. and transfer to a cooking rack.

recipes.title: Cherry Spice Sandwich Cookies
instructions: To make the cookies, add the almond flour, arrowroot, coconut flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, orange zest and nuts to a bowl. Stir to combine.

Then pour in the coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla and water. Stir until well combined. If needed, add extra water to get the dough to stick together. Continue stirring until you can form the dough into a ball with your hands.

Divide the ball into 2 portions and roll each one into a 4” long log. Wrap the logs in parchment paper and transfer to the fridge. Chill at least 30 min. The longer it chills, the easier it is to slice.

While dough is chilling, prepare the filling. Add all the ingredients to the blender and blend until smooth. Transfer to a sauce pan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Simmer until most of the liquid has evaporated and consistency is spreadable. Stir every few minutes to avoid burning. Once ready, remove from heat and set aside to cool.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and line baking sheet with parchment paper. Remove dough from fridge, remove wrapper, and slice each log into 12 rounds. Evenly spread them out on the baking sheet.
Bake for 12 minutes, remove, and let cool completely.
Spread 1 Tbsp of cherry filling onto one side of a cookie and place another cooie on top to make a sandwich. Repeat until all sandwiches are made.
Refrigerate up to 1 week or freeze.

recipes.title: Chia Caramel Apple Parfait
instructions: Combine Chia mix ingredients in a small bowl. Cover and place in the fridge to soak for at least 3 hours.
For the apple mix, melt the coconut oil in a saucepan on medium heat and add the apples. Saute for a few minutes, then add the coconut sugar and coconut milk.
Allow to cook until a thick caramel is formed, stirring continuously until the apples have softened.
Add the cinnamon and salt and stir to combine.
Layer the chia pudding with the caramel apples in a dish (we use canning jars with lids) and serve or refrigerate for later.

recipes.title: Chocolate "Cheesecake"
recipes.notes: Optional Strawberry Sauce topper: Combine 5 oz. of thawed frozen strawberries with 1 Tbsp. pure maple syrup and blend until smooth. Mix with 5 oz. chopped strawberries for texture and spoon over each slice.
instructions: Soak the macadamia nuts for 1 hour in water, then drain.
Melt coconut oil in a glass dish in the oven until liquid.
Prepare crust: Place pecans in food processor/blender and grind to a fine meal.  Add rest of crust ingredients and process again until well combined.
Press mixture into the bottom of a pie pan and place in the freezer while preparing the filling.
Prepare filling: In a high powered food processor/blender, process the macadamia nuts into a fine meal.
Add in zucchini, cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla and sea salt. Blend again until a smooth and creamy batter is formed.
Add in coconut oil and blend to mix uniformly.
Pour the filling into the frozen pie crust, place back in the freezer and allow to set.
Remove from the tray and place in an airtight storage container.
Store in the freezer until ready to eat. Serve directly from the freezer for best texture (becomes soft at room temp).

recipes.title: Chocolate Almond Butter Swirl Brownies
instructions: In a small bowl, combine the almond meal, cocoa powder and baking powder.  In a separate bowl, combine the melted coconut oil and honey, and stir well.
Add the vanilla to the wet ingredients.  When the coconut oil has cooled, add the eggs.
Combine the wet and dry mixtures, stirring well.  Add the dark chocolate chips.
Line your slow cooker with parchment paper and pour in the mixture on top of it.  Drop the almond butter on top of the mixture, and using a knife, swirl it around.
Cover and cook on LOW for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Chocolate Cherry Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium bowl, beat egg whites and sea salt until frothy. Add vanilla, almond extract, coconut flour, almond flour, cocoa powder and maple syrup.  Mix briefly to incorporate.
Stir in coconut, cherries, almonds and chocolate chips.
Scoop rounded tablespoons of dough on an (unbleached) parchment paper lined baking sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until cookies are firm to the touch.
Remove from the oven and transfer parchment paper to a wire rack to cool. Store in an airtight container or freeze for later use.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chunk Cookies
recipes.notes: Makes 8-10 cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine dry ingredients in a small bowl (except chocolate chips).
Whisk together wet ingredients in a medium bowl.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix together. Add chocolate chips and mix well.
Drop a tablespoonful of batter at a time onto the cookie sheet, and lightly press the center down on each cookie.
Bake for 11 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool 2-3 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack. They will become firm after a few minutes.

recipes.title: Chocolate Dipped Strawberry Macaroons
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a food processor or high speed blender, puree half the bag of freeze dried strawberries until it becomes a fine powder.  Coarsely chop the other half of the bag of strawberries.
In a medium sized bowl, beat the egg white with the sea salt until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold in strawberry powder, chopped strawberries and remaining ingredients into the egg whites until just combined.
Scoop the dough into golf ball sized balls and place them on parchment lined baking sheets.
Bake for 13-15 min or until bottoms turn golden brown.  Place parchment paper on a wire rack and let cool completely.

Meanwhile, melt the dark chocolate and palm shortening in a double boiler over simmering water, stir until smooth.  Dip the bottom of each cookie into melted chocolate and place on parchment paper until chocolate hardens.
Drizzle leftover chocolate over tops of cookies.  Store in an airtight container in the fridge or freeze until needed.

recipes.title: Chocolate Fudge
instructions: Place the coconut milk in a saucepan over medium heat for 5 minutes. Stir in the cacao butter, maple syrup, coffee and vanilla and cook for 20 more minutes. Stir in the salt.
Place the chopped chocolate in a large glass bowl. Pour the coconut mixture over it, and stir slowly until melted and smooth. Let sit at room temperature for 40 minutes.

Line an 8” x 8” glass baking dish with parchment paper. Pour the chocolate mixture into the baking dish and spread to flatten. Sprinkle with chopped pecans. Cover and place in the refrigerator to chill for 2 hours.
When ready to serve, remove from the fridge and let sit at room temperature for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Pecans
instructions: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees.
In a small bowl, mix together sea salt, cinnamon and arrowroot starch and set aside.
Measure maple syrup into a medium sized bowl. Add pecans to the maple syrup and toss to coat.  Sprinkle spice mixture over pecans and stir to coat evenly.
Spread the pecans in a single layer on a parchment lined baking sheet and bake for 30 min.
Then turn the oven off and leave them in the oven for another 30 min. Remove and let cool.
Store in an airtight container or freeze for future use.

recipes.title: Fresh Fruit Jello Bites
ingredients: 2 cups of Fruit of your Choice (cherries, strawberries, etc), pureed in blender
instructions: Lightly grease a mini muffin pan with coconut oil.
Put the water in a small bowl. Pour the gelatin into the water and let stand for 1 minute.
Heat the apple juice in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. When the juice simmers, add the gelatin mixture and stir until completely dissolved.
Remove from heat and combine with pureed fruit. Pour into the muffin cups and refrigerate for 3 or more hours to firmly set.
To serve, run a knife around the outside edge of muffin cups and coax out the jello bites.

recipes.title: Ginger Orange Pecans
instructions: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees.
In a small bowl, mix together sea salt, ginger and arrowroot starch and set aside.
Measure maple syrup into a medium sized bowl and set aside.
Zest the skin of approximately 2 oranges and set aside.
Add pecans to the maple syrup and toss to coat.  Sprinkle spice mixture and orange zest over pecans and stir to coat evenly.
Spread the pecans in a single layer on a parchment lined baking sheet and bake for 30 min.
Then turn the oven off and leave the nuts in the oven for another 30 min.
Remove and let cool. Store in an airtight container or freeze for future use.

recipes.title: Homemade Jello
ingredients: 4 Cups - Juice (Organic Grape Juice is a favorite)
instructions: Add 1 cup of the juice to a bowl and sprinkle with 4 Tbsp. gelatin. Whisk together to combine and allow to sit for 5 minutes to thicken.
Pour remaining juice into a saucepan and heat until almost boiling.
Remove from heat and stir in honey until dissolved (optional). Add the gelatin mixture and stir until dissolved.
Pour into an 8” x 8” glass baking dish or into individual sized jars.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until set.

recipes.title: Lemon Blueberry Cookies
recipes.notes: To make the recipe egg free, substitute with the following: Place 1 ¼ tsp. of unflavored grass fed gelatin in a small bowl. Add 3 Tbsp. of hot water and blend together immediately until frothy (about 30 seconds). Add to the recipe right away and mix in.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.  Put coconut oil in a glass jar and place in the oven to melt.

In a medium sized bowl, combine all dry ingredients. Add the maple syrup, vanilla extract, egg and lemon juice and blend.  Slowly add coconut oil and blend well.  Stir in lemon zest and blueberries.  Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
Stir once more and scoop into 1 inch balls.  Place balls on a parchment lined cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes or until centers are done.  Move parchment paper to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Lemon Coconut Loaf
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium sized bowl, combine dry ingredients. Add all wet ingredients and mix well.
Stir in lemon zest and ⅓ cup shredded coconut.
Grease 2 mini loaf pans with coconut oil and divide the batter evenly between the two pans.  Sprinkle shredded coconut over the tops.
Bake for 35-40 min. or until loaves are golden brown and the centers spring back when pressed.
Remove pans from the oven and let cool on a wire rack for 15 min.
Turn the loaves out onto the wire rack to finish cooling completely.
Slice and serve, or freeze in airtight containers for future use.

recipes.title: Maca Chocolate Pie
instructions: Melt coconut oil in a glass dish in the oven.
Rub a small amount of coconut oil in the bottom of the pie pan.
Add all the crust ingredients into a blender. Then put the mixture in the pie plate and press evenly to the bottom and place in the freezer while preparing the filling.
Place all the filling ingredients in the blender and process until smooth. Add water if needed. Filling should be the consistency of thick pudding.
Take the crust out of the freezer and pour in the filling. Spread out evenly over the crust.
Place back in the freezer for 2 hours. Then cover with plastic wrap and keep in the freezer until 15 minutes before ready to serve.

recipes.title: Maple Butter Cups
instructions: Line a mini muffin tin with paper cup liners (makes 24).
Combine 1 cup of the chocolate chips and 1 Tbsp. coconut oil on the stove in a double boiler and melt until smooth.
Pour a small amount of the chocolate mixture into each cup, just enough to cover the bottom.
Place in the freezer for 10 minutes.
Take out of the freezer. Scoop a small dab of maple butter in the center of each cup.
Melt the other 1 cup of chocolate chips and 1 Tbsp. coconut oil in the double boiler.
Pour over the top of the cups, covering the maple butter.
Return to the freezer for 10 more minutes.
Store in the fridge or freezer.

recipes.title: No-Cook Chocolate Pudding
instructions: Place all ingredients in a high speed blender and blend until smooth (about 45 seconds).
Pour into serving size dishes, cover, and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.

recipes.title: Orange Cream Popsicles
recipes.notes: Contributed by T. Franco
instructions: Mix well and pour into popsicle mold.
Freeze and enjoy!

recipes.title: Oreo Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees.
Mix all cookie ingredients in a bowl and stir together well.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Form small balls of cookie dough about 1 tsp. in size and flatten down with the palm of your hand.
Bake for 10 minutes. After cookies are done, let them sit and do not touch until fully cool.

Put the coconut sugar into a high speed blender on high until a powder forms. Combine all the filling ingredients in a small bowl. Spread between layers of cookies. Store in the fridge for up to a week.

recipes.title: Pie Crust
instructions: Melt coconut oil in a glass dish in the oven until liquid.
Place pecans in a food processor/blender and grind to a fine meal.
Add rest of crust ingredients and process again until well combined.
Press mixture into the bottom of a pie pan and place in the freezer until ready to use.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie Chia Pudding
recipes.notes: Recipe by Avocado Skillet (Contributed by Laura F.)
instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a mason jar until fully combined.
Refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie Custard
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Boil a pot of water (enough to fill the baking pan as directed below).
In a small mixing bowl, combine the dry ingredients. In a separate medium sized mixing bowl, combine the wet ingredients. Whisk with a mixer. Add dry ingredients and mix again until combined.

Pour the custard into small ramekins (oven-safe or glass dishes). Place the ramekins in a 9x13 glass casserole dish and add enough boiling water to the dish to bring the water up halfway to the top of the ramekins. Carefully place the casserole dish in the oven.
Bake for 50 minutes. Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.title: Raspberry Sorbet
ingredients: 1 10oz. Bag Frozen Strawberries (you can use any combo of frozen fruits)
instructions: In a blender, pulse berries and apple juice until almost smooth.
Add maple syrup and vanilla.  Continue to puree until a smooth texture is achieved.
Scoop out into single serve bowls with lids.
Store in the freezer. (Thaw for 10 min before serving).

recipes.title: Raw Almond Lime Bites
instructions: Add almond flour, shredded coconut, vanilla, coconut milk, lime juice and zest, salt and coconut sugar in the blender.

In a small pot on low heat, add coconut butter and coconut oil and melt. Once melted, add to the blender and blend for 45 seconds or until combined into a sticky dough. You may need to scrape down the sides as you go. Transfer the blender to the fridge and chill for 10 minutes.
In a small bowl, combine coconut sugar, lime juice and lime zest for the glaze. If it is too runny, add coconut or almond flour in small quantities until it reaches spreading consistency.
Chop the pistachios and set aside.
Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Using damp hands, separate the dough from the blender into golf ball sized pieces and place on the cookie sheet, flatten slightly.
Transfer the cookie sheet to the fridge and chill for 10 more minutes.
Remove from the fridge and cover with glaze. Then sprinkle with pistachios. Place in the freezer for 10 minutes to firm up.
Store in the fridge or freezer.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Brownies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Cook the sweet potato for 1 hour, then puree it with a mixer in a medium bowl.
Add almond butter, cocoa powder, vanilla and maple syrup. Mix until well combined.
Pour into a glass 8x8 pan. (Optional: top with almonds and/or dark chocolate chips).
Place in the oven and bake for 23 minutes.

recipes.title: Tigernut Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Melt the coconut butter in a glass dish in the oven.
Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl and mix.
Roll into balls and place on a parchment paper lined cookie sheet. Press to flatten.
Bake for 15 minutes. Let cool before serving.

recipes.title: Grain and Dairy-Free Tiramisu
instructions: Make Ladyfingers first (see Ladyfinger Ingredients above).
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, cream the palm shortening and coconut sugar together until well mixed. Add the vanilla, flours, arrowroot/tapioca and baking powder. Whisk together until just combined.
Take about a tablespoon at a time and flatten down into round circles on the parchment paper, about an inch apart.
Bake for 10 minutes. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before transferring the parchment paper with cookies to a wire rack to cool completely. Be careful, these will be very crumbly.
Move on to Tiramisu recipe. Prepare the cup of coffee in a mug and set aside to cool to room temperature.
Beat the coconut cream, coconut sugar and vanilla until thick and smooth.
Add in the Kite Hill cream cheese and mix until smooth again.

You can use an 8”x8” glass dish or individual sized serving dishes to layer ingredients as follows: Take one cookie at a time and dip it into the coffee for about 30 seconds. Place it in the bottom of the dish until the bottom of the dish is covered. Spread half of the creamed mixture on top of the cookies.
Repeat the process with the second layer of ladyfingers and cream mixture. Dust the tops with cocoa powder.
Cover and refrigerate 2-4 hours.

recipes.title: Almond Milk Nog
instructions: Mix in a blender.
Pour over ice. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Blueberry Breakfast Shake
instructions: Blend on high speed until smooth.

recipes.title: Citrus Vanilla Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup - Vanilla Coconut Milk (Adjust More or Less to Desired Thickness)
instructions: Add all ingredients (except protein powder) to the blender and blend until smooth.
Add protein powder and pulse until just mixed through.

recipes.title: Coconut Chai Smoothie
instructions: Add all ingredients to the blender and blend until smooth.

recipes.title: Dr. Greg's Autumn Shake
ingredients: 1 cup - Cold Cooked Pumpkin OR Winter Squash
2 Tbsp - Almond Butter OR Handful of Walnuts
1 Tbsp - Pure Maple Syrup OR 3 Medjool Dates, Pitted
TODO: figure out alternatives that are listed as sub-bullet points
instructions: Put ingredients in a blender.
Blend on high until creamy and smooth. Add more coconut milk if needed.

recipes.title: Drew's Frozen Hot Chocolate
ingredients: Optional: Coconut Whipped Cream and Dark Chocolate Chips
instructions: Melt the dark chocolate in a double boiler.
Mix all ingredients in the blender.
Pour over ice. Delish!

recipes.title: Maca Latte
instructions: Add all ingredients to the blender and blend until smooth.

recipes.title: Mango Mint Smoothie
ingredients: 1/2 cup - Lightly Packed Fresh Mint Leaves
instructions: Blend ingredients in a high powered blender until creamy and smooth.

recipes.title: Raspberry Peach Lemonade
instructions: Combine 1 cup of water with the raspberries, peaches and honey in a saucepan placed over medium heat.
Simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes.
Pour the mixture into a blender and blend until smooth.
Strain the liquid through mesh to remove raspberry seeds. (If you have a Vitamix, there is no need to perform this step)
Pour the mixture into a pitcher. Whisk in the lemon juice and remaining 5 cups of water.
Refrigerate and serve chilled with ice.

recipes.title: Watermelon Limeade
recipes.notes: This makes a great post-workout electrolyte drink (without all the added junk)!
instructions: Mix in a blender.
Enjoy!

recipes.title: Artichoke Chicken with Mushroom Sauce
ingredients: 1 Head Cauliflower, Chopped  (or 1 Package Frozen Chopped Cauliflower)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Place 4 Tbsp. coconut oil into a stockpot and heat to medium on the stove. Rinse and dry all the chicken, then sprinkle with salt, pepper and paprika.
Add the chicken to the pot and cook for 8 minutes, turning every 2 minutes to brown evenly on all sides.
Remove the chicken and set aside in a large glass casserole dish. Add the remaining 2 Tbsp. of coconut oil to the pot, then add the mushrooms and saute for 5 minutes.
Stir in the broth, vinegar, honey and coconut flour and simmer for 10 minutes.

Pour the artichoke hearts into the dish with the chicken. Add capers and cauliflower. Spoon the sauce over the top. Cover and bake in the oven for 40 min. Remove and finish with a sprinkle of salt and paprika.

recipes.title: Asian Lettuce Rolls
recipes.notes: Recipe Contributed by Rachel G.
instructions: Put sauce ingredients in the blender and mix, then put in the fridge until ready to use.
Wash the leaves you will be using as the wrap and set aside.
Chop the herbs, cucumber, and green onions and place in separate bowls.
Cook the miracle or cauliflower rice according to package directions. Set aside for later.
Brown the meat, sprinkle with sea salt and set aside.
Slice the avocado.
Start with a piece of lettuce. Fill with meat, rice, herbs, cucumber, green onion and avocado. Top with sauce and roll it up.

recipes.title: Asian Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: 1 8oz. Can - Bamboo Shoots, Chopped into Small Strips
instructions: Add coconut oil to the skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and saute until browned.
Add the mushrooms, carrots, bamboo, ginger and garlic. Saute for another 5 minutes until carrots soften.
Add the coconut aminos and pepper and mix. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 5 more minutes. Remove from heat and scoop into butter lettuce leaves.
Add avocado on top if desired.

recipes.title: Baked Coconut Chicken
instructions: Coat the chicken with melted coconut oil and roll in a mixture of coconut flakes and almond meal.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 28 min.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with veggies.

recipes.title: Baked Salmon
instructions: Place salmon in a glass dish and set aside.
Whisk together the remaining ingredients in a small bowl.
Pour 3/4 of the mixture over the salmon and let marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Transfer salmon to a parchment lined baking dish, skin side down. Bake for 17 minutes at 400 degrees or until flaky.
Drizzle on the remaining sauce and return to the oven for 1 minute. Remove and serve.

recipes.title: Balsamic Roast Beef
ingredients: 3 Sweet Potatoes, peeled and cut into pieces
Sea Salt and Black Pepper to Taste
instructions: Season the roast with salt and pepper.
Melt coconut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the roast for 2-3 minutes on each side.
Place the meat in the slow cooker. Top it with the leek, garlic, red wine (opt.), balsamic vinegar, beef broth, rosemary and bay leaves.
Cover the slow cooker and set it to low for 3 1/2 hours.
After the 3 1/2 hours, add the sweet potatoes and continue to cook on low for another 4 hours.
Remove and discard the bay leaves and rosemary sprigs.

Pour the liquid from the slow cooker into a saucepan and bring to a slow boil over medium-high heat. Keep it boiling and let it reduce until you get the desired consistency for your sauce (about 15 minutes).
Pour the sauce back into the slow cooker and serve with the meat and sweet potatoes.

recipes.title: Barbeque Apple Chicken
ingredients: 1 Bottle of Barbeque Sauce of your Choice (Our Favorite: Brownwood Farm's Cherry Barbeque Sauce)
instructions: Place all the ingredients in the slow cooker and cover and cook on LOW for 4-5 hours.

recipes.title: Basil Burgers
instructions: Mix all together and make into 4 patties.
Bake or grill.  We eat them without a bun!

recipes.title: Beef Stew
ingredients: 2 lbs. - Grass Fed Stew Meat, Cut into 1” Cubes
Sea Salt and Pepper to Taste
instructions: Heat the avocado oil in a skillet. Add the meat and cook on medium/low heat until edges are browned.
Place meat in a slow cooker.  Add salt and pepper, and stir to coat.
Add remaining ingredients and stir to mix.  Cover and cook on LOW 8-10 hours (or HIGH 4-5 hours).
Stir thoroughly before serving.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Tapioca Starch or Arrowroot Powder
instructions: Saute the mushrooms, onions and beef in coconut oil in a skillet until almost cooked through. Transfer to crockpot.
Add the rest of the ingredients (except cauliflower rice) to the crockpot and cook on low for 4 hours.
Cook the cauliflower rice.
Serve the beef mixture over top of the cauliflower.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash Lasagna
instructions: Place coconut oil in the bottom of a large soup pot on medium heat.  Add the carrots, onions, zucchini, and mushrooms and sauté until tender.
While veggies are cooking, brown the beef and sausage on medium heat in a separate skillet until fully cooked.  Add the beef/sausage mix to the veggies in the soup pot.
Add the remaining ingredients except for butternut squash, mix well, and simmer for 30 min.

While the sauce simmers, peel, halve, and scoop out the seeds of the butternut squash.  Cut the cleaned squash lengthwise in ¼” to 1/2 “ thick strips (resembling thick lasagna noodles).  It doesn't have to be perfect!
In the slow cooker, ladle in a layer of the meat sauce, then evenly spread the squash slices on top.  Continue to alternate until you have reached 4 layers or more.
Cover and cook on LOW for 4-6 hrs.

recipes.title: Chicken Cilantro Lime Skillet
ingredients: 1 Medium Butternut Squash, Peeled and Cubed
1 Small Head Cauliflower, Cut into Florets
Sea Salt and Pepper to Taste
instructions: Cook the chicken in the oven at 350 degrees for about 18 minutes or until cooked through. Chop and set aside.
While the chicken is cooking, put the butternut squash cubes into the blender and pulse until you get rice-size crumbles.
Heat coconut oil in a large stock pot over medium heat. Add the squash and stir occasionally to cook.

In the meantime, chop the cauliflower, add it to the blender and pulse until you get rice-sized crumbles. Then add to the squash and cook, stirring occasionally. When the cauliflower-squash rice is tender (about 10-15 minutes), add the cooked chicken and mix. Season with salt and pepper. Add cilantro and lime juice.
Serve with optional dressing if desired.

recipes.title: Chicken Salad
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups - Chopped, Cooked Organic Chicken or Turkey
2 Stalks Chopped Celery or Fennel Bulb
1 Handful of Grapes or Dried Cherries
Sea Salt and Pepper to Taste
instructions: Combine ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve over a bed of lettuce.

recipes.title: Chicken Zucchini Noodle Dinner
ingredients: 2-3 Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, Chopped into Bite Size Pieces
instructions: Spiralize the zucchini and set aside.

Cook the meat in a skillet on med/low until cooked through. While cooking the meat, saute the zucchini noodles in the coconut oil in a separate deep skillet or large stock pot, and cook until soft (about 8-10 minutes).
In a small bowl, mix the basil, garlic, pepper, salt and olive oil.
When everything is ready, Spoon zucchini noodles onto plates, then add chicken and drizzle olive oil mixture.
Sprinkle pine nuts and green onion on top. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chipotle Chicken Stew
instructions: Marinate the chicken breasts overnight.
The next day, place the coconut oil, onion, turnip, rutabaga, and squash in the slow cooker.
Cut the chicken and place it on top of the veggies (discard the marinade).
Add the rest of the ingredients, cover, and cook on LOW for 4-6 hrs.

recipes.title: Chipotle Meatballs
instructions: In a medium sized mixing bowl, thoroughly mix together all of the meatball ingredients with your hands and set aside.
Put the onion, garlic, tomato sauce and beef broth into the slow cooker and mix well.  Add the honey and spices and whisk together.
Form the meat mixture into balls, golf ball sized.  Gently drop each meatball into the sauce in the slow cooker.  Cover and cook on LOW for 6-7 hrs.  Serve garnished with cilantro.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chili
instructions: Heat a large skillet on medium-high heat, then add coconut oil.  When oil is melted, add onions and cook until translucent.  Add garlic.
Crumble the ground meat into the skillet and stir to combine.  Continue to cook meat mixture, stirring often until it is cooked through.
Add it to a large crockpot.  Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well.  Set the crockpot on low for 2.5 hours.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Ginger Lamb
instructions: Place the cinnamon sticks on the bottom of the slow cooker.
Place the lamb on top of the cinnamon sticks.
Chop the onion and carrots and place them on top of the lamb.
Add the garlic and ginger and remaining spices.
Cover and cook on LOW for 8 hrs.

recipes.title: Citrus Red Onion Slaw with Grilled Chicken
instructions: Combine salad ingredients in a large bowl.
In a jar with a tight fitting lid, combine the dressing ingredients.  Shake well and pour over salad.  Toss to coat.
Store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Coconut Macadamia Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
In a food processor/blender, combine macadamia nuts and shredded coconut.
Place the chicken in a 9x13 baking dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread each chicken breast with 1 tsp. mayo. Spread nut mixture onto chicken, spreading equally.
Bake for 40 minutes on the center rack. Serve with fresh lime zest and juice on top, and top with cilantro.

recipes.title: Fiesta Lime Chicken
instructions: Thinly slice the onions into strips and place them in the slow cooker.
Cut one lime in half and squeeze juice over the onions.
Place the chicken on top of the onions and evenly sprinkle with half of the taco seasoning.  Turn the chicken over and season the other side with remaining seasoning.
Squeeze the remaining limes over the chicken and add the chicken broth.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 3.5 hours.

recipes.title: Fish with Mango Salsa
recipes.notes: This recipe goes really well with the Cilantro Cauliflower Rice!
instructions: Prepare the salsa except for the avocado, cover and place in the fridge.
Wash and dry the fish. Place in a parchment lined baking dish, season with salt and pepper to taste, and bake until done. Remove from the oven.
Remove salsa from the fridge and add the chopped avocado. Place the fish on plates and spoon the salsa over the top.

recipes.title: Green Goddess Chicken
instructions: Start the night before: Mix the marinade ingredients in a medium bowl. Dip chicken pieces in the bowl to cover both sides and lay flat in a 9”x13” glass casserole dish. Cover and place in the fridge overnight.
Place the sauce ingredients in a blender or food processor and blend for 30 seconds until smooth. Scoop out into a small bowl and place in the fridge to chill while preparing the rest of the recipe.
Drizzle chicken with olive oil. Cook the chicken in the oven at 350 degrees for about 18 minutes or until cooked through.
While chicken is cooking, wash and prepare lettuce for salad. Place on plates. Add a few slices of the remaining half of avocado to the salads.
Add a scoop of the green goddess sauce to the plate. Add chicken to the plates.
Drizzle salad and chicken with olive oil and a squeeze of lemon.
Dip the chicken in the green goddess sauce. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Grilled Chicken and Antipasto Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine salad ingredients and set aside.
In a jar with a tight fitting lid, combine dressing ingredients and shake to mix well.
Pour dressing over the salad, mix, and refrigerate until ready to eat. Stir again before serving. Serve over lettuce.

recipes.title: Hearty Pot Pie
recipes.notes: Serves 2-3. Double recipe for more servings. Thank you to Taylor for sharing this recipe!!
instructions: For the crust, use a fork to stir together the almond flour, tapioca flour, salt and baking powder.
Cut in the palm shortening until the mixture is crumbly.
Stir in the cold water. Place in the refrigerator while you prepare the filling.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.

recipes.title: Lamb Stew
ingredients: 1.5 lbs. - Grass Fed Lamb Stew Meat, Cut into 1” Cubes
instructions: Heat 2 Tbsp oil in a skillet on medium heat. Saute the onion/leek, carrots and potatoes for  4 minutes. Add garlic, salt and pepper and mix. Add to the crockpot.
Add 1 Tbsp oil to the empty skillet and cook the meat on medium heat until edges are browned on all sides. Season with salt and pepper.
Place meat in the slow cooker.
Add remaining ingredients and stir to mix.  Cover and cook on LOW  for 4-5 hours.
Stir thoroughly before serving.

recipes.title: Lectin Free Chili
ingredients: 1 - Medium Onion or 3 Small Leeks, Chopped
instructions: Bake the sweet potato for about an hour at 375 degrees and set aside. (this can be done the day before if desired).
Cook the ground beef and 1 tsp. salt in a skillet until broken up in small pieces and about halfway cooked. Transfer to crockpot.

Use the same skillet to heat avocado oil. Then add garlic, onion, and celery and cook for 5 minutes until soft. Add the chili powder, cumin, cinnamon and cloves and stir, cooking for 1 more minute. Pour in the broth, scraping the bottom of the pan and transfer to the crockpot.
Add to the crockpot: pine nuts, sweet potato puree, adobo seasoning, wine vinegar, coconut aminos, 2 tsp. salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and cook on low for 5 hours.

recipes.title: Maple Roasted Chicken with Sweet Potatoes
ingredients: 2 Sweet Potatoes, Peeled and Cut into 1" Chunks
instructions: Place all ingredients into the slow cooker.
Cook on Low for 6 hours.

recipes.title: Meatloaf
ingredients: 1/2 cup - Crushed Almond Crackers (We use Simple Mills Sea Salt)
Top with Barbeque Sauce (Our Favorite- Brownwood Farm's Cherry Barbeque Sauce)
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Shape into a loaf and place in a slow cooker.
Top with sauce. Cook on low for 3.5-4 hours.

recipes.title: Mild shredded Chicken
recipes.notes: Super easy and quick!! Great to serve over the top of a salad or other greens.
ingredients: All Natural Barbeque Sauce (Our favorite is Brownwood Farms Cherry Barbeque Sauce)
instructions: Place the chicken breasts in the slow cooker and pour the sauce over them.
Cover and cook on low for 4 hours.
When done, shred the chicken with a knife and fork and mix well.

recipes.title: Orange Pan Seared Scallops
instructions: Clean and dry scallops. Sprinkle both sides with salt, pepper and garlic powder.
Melt the coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Place scallops into the hot pan and allow them to sear for 2-3 minutes. Turn to sear the other side until cooked all the way through.
While the scallops are cooking, combine the deglazing ingredients in a bowl. After removing scallops from the pan, turn the heat to high and pour in the deglazing liquid.
Use a whisk to remove the seared bits of scallops from the bottom of the pan to flavor the sauce. Reduce the remaining liquid over high heat for 2-3 minutes.
Serve the scallops with sauce drizzled over the top and garnished with orange zest.

recipes.title: Pistachio Crusted Salmon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Line a glass dish with parchment paper and place salmon filets in one layer, skin down.
In a bowl, combine the pistachio, lemon juice, mustard, honey, salt and pepper to taste.
Spread mixture on top of salmon fillets, pressing lightly to make it stick.
Place salmon in the oven and bake uncovered for 18-20 minutes or until cooked through.
Let salmon cool 2-4 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Ryan's Chipotle Bowl
instructions: Cook the cauliflower/Miracle Rice in a pot on low heat.
Brown the ground beef in a skillet. Add taco seasoning and mix well.
Line it all up buffet style and create your bowl!

recipes.title: Sesame Orange Chicken
instructions: Place chicken in the slow cooker. Place the remaining crockpot ingredients in a bowl, whisk together, and pour over the chicken. Flip the chicken over to fully coat. Cook the chicken on low for 4 hours.
Remove the chicken from the sauce and chop it into bite size pieces. Transfer the sauce from the crockpot into a small saucepan. Return the chicken to the crockpot and cover to keep warm.
Add tapioca flour to the sauce and simmer on the stovetop over medium heat until it becomes thickened. Pour back over the chicken in the crockpot.
Heat the cauliflower rice in a pot until warm.
Spoon the mixture onto plates on top of the cauliflower rice. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and top with chopped green onions.

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Ham
instructions: Decorate the outside of the ham by inserting as many whole cloves as you like into it (just push the smaller side in toward the center of the ham, so it is sticking out the top). Or, sprinkle ground cloves on the top.

Place ham in the slow cooker.  Pour both juices over the top and Drizzle the ham with the maple syrup.  Cover and cook on LOW for 8 hours or until the internal temp. reaches 160 degrees. (If you are using a fully pre-cooked ham, cook on LOW for 2 hrs. and then set to warm until ready to eat).

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Short Ribs
instructions: Season the ribs on all sides with salt and pepper.
Melt coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sear the ribs  on each of the 4 sides for about 60 seconds on each side. Set aside.
Pour the beef broth, worcestershire sauce, garlic powder and onion powder into a slow cooker and stir together.
Place the ribs into the liquid in the slow cooker. Spoon the liquid over the top of the ribs to saturate.
Place the rosemary sprig on top of the meat and place the lid on the slow cooker.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours.

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Whole Chicken
recipes.notes: After we eat the chicken for dinner, we strain the liquid from the slow cooker into a stock pot, add a little extra water, throw in some veggies and a few spices and pick off the rest of the chicken meat from the bones left over (you can use the pieces of meat that no one likes to eat at dinner, like the back meat).  It makes a very yummy soup that will last a couple days.  This really makes the extra cost of a pasture raised bird worth it! While the soup (above) is cooking, we will take the remaining bones and put them back into the crockpot, cover completely with water and follow the bone broth recipe in the “Soups and Sauces” section of this cookbook! Simple, easy and healthy way to get the most out of a single bird!
ingredients: Your Favorite Spices (Chophouse Seasoning, Sea Salt and/or Chicken Rub Spice)
instructions: Add a few inches of water to the bottom of the slow cooker (this can be used after the chicken is cooked as a base to make veggie soup-see below).  Rinse the chicken and place it into the slow cooker.  Add spices.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours or LOW for 6 hours.

recipes.title: Steak and Root Vegetable Chili
ingredients: 2 Sweet Potatoes, Peeled and Cut into 1" Cubes
Optional: Chopped Green Onion for Garnish
instructions: In a large skillet, heat oil over med-high heat.  Add the meat and brown all sides for about 5 min.
Add all the ingredients to the slow cooker.  Stir well to combine.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.

recipes.title: Stuffed Acorn Squash
ingredients: 1 lb - Italian Seasoned Bulk Chicken Sausage
instructions: Place 1 cup of water in the bottom of slow cooker.  Cut the acorn squash in half, lengthwise, scoop out the seeds, and set aside.
In a large skillet, brown the sausage over medium heat.  Add the onions, mushrooms and spinach to the sausage, and cook for 1-2 minutes.  Remove from heat.
Stuff the cavity of the squash with as much of the mixture as you can (It is okay to overstuff them).  Carefully place them in the slow cooker, and repeat for the remaining squash halves.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours.

recipes.title: Jalapeno Sweet Potato Chowder
ingredients: 3 - Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, Cut to Stew Size Pieces
instructions: Cook the sweet potatoes the night before and store in the fridge.
The next day, place the chicken in the slow cooker.
Add the onions, carrots, celery, jalapeno peppers and coconut oil.
Scoop out the sweet potato insides and place in a blender with one cup of the chicken broth.  Puree until smooth and add to the slow cooker.
Add the coconut milk and remaining chicken broth and stir well.  Cover and cook on LOW for 4 hrs.  Uncover and cook on LOW for another half hour.  This will thicken the chowder.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Nachos
recipes.notes: If you are in a pinch for time, use Siete brand grain free chips instead of sweet potatoes.
instructions: Slice sweet potatoes, drizzle with melted coconut oil and spread out on a parchment paper lined cookie sheet. Sprinkle with sea salt to taste.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Saute ground beef with onion powder and minced garlic in 1 Tbsp. coconut oil until cooked through.
Add cumin, coriander and paprika and sea salt. Remove from heat and cover to keep warm.
Prepare guacamole by mixing mashed avocados, juice from 1 lime, olive oil and cilantro. Set aside.
Set up a nacho assembly line with sweet potato chips, meat mix, guacamole and olives.

recipes.title: Thai Stir Fry
ingredients: 1/2 pound - Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, Sliced into Bite Size Pieces
2 cups - Broccoli, Cut into Small Chunks
instructions: Slice the chicken and set aside.
Peel the carrots. Lay them on their side on a cutting board and use a peeler to slice them lengthwise into small strips (peel down to the core and then flip and peel the other side).
Chop the broccoli.
Cook the miracle rice or cauliflower rice according to package directions.
Heat the oil in a large stock pot. Add the garlic and chicken and stir for about 5 minutes, until chicken is white on the outside. Add the rest of the ingredients and cook for 10 more minutes.
Serve over the miracle (or cauliflower) rice. Top with green onions if desired and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Turkey Cauliflower Casserole
recipes.notes: This is a great way to use up leftover turkey after Thanksgiving, or you can substitute leftover chicken!
ingredients: 2 Cups - Leftover Cooked and Chopped Turkey or Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Place the meat and frozen riced cauliflower into a casserole dish and set aside.
Heat the coconut oil in a saucepan on medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the arrowroot flour and stir until golden.
Add the coconut milk and bring to a low simmer, stirring until combined.
Stir in the mayo, salt and pepper and mix well.
Pour sauce mixture over the turkey and cauliflower in the casserole dish and stir to mix,
Bake for 45 minutes.
While it is cooking, cook the bacon and chop it into small pieces.
When casserole is finished, remove from the oven and sprinkle with bacon and parsley.

recipes.title: Asparagus Bacon Soup
instructions: Heat the coconut oil in a large stock pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes or until translucent, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the garlic and cook for one minute until softened.
Add the asparagus and cauliflower and stir for one minute, then pour in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes.
Continue to simmer the soup for 20 minutes or until the veggies are very tender.
Add the parsley and blend until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Cook the bacon in the oven for 15 minutes until golden and crisp.
Remove from the oven and chop into bite size pieces. Set aside.
Ladle the soup into a bowl and add bacon on top.

recipes.title: Beef and Veggie Soup
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Fresh Basil Leaves, Finely Chopped
instructions: Melt the coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the beef in a single layer and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. Transfer the beef to the slow cooker.
Add the onions and garlic to the skillet and saute until softened, about 8 minutes. Transfer onions and garlic to a slow cooker, including any liquid in the skillet.
Add the broth and carrots to the slow cooker, set to low, and cook for 6 hours.
With 2 hours left of cook time, add the green beans, cauliflower, basil and parsley, and salt and pepper to taste.
Store leftovers in the fridge.

recipes.title: Bone Broth
recipes.notes: Bone broth is extremely healthy and VERY easy to make.  It contains beneficial building blocks for your body, like collagen, marrow, glycine, hyaluronic acid, chondroitin sulfate, calcium, magnesium and potassium. This is helpful in reducing inflammation and assisting in gut healing.
ingredients: Soup Bones (from a healthy organic grass fed/pasture raised animal)
2 Tbsp - Apple Cider Vinegar (this helps release the bone minerals)
instructions: Place the bones in your slow cooker. Wash the veggies and add them to the slow cooker, no need to chop. Cover ingredients with a generous amount of water. Add apple cider vinegar. Cover and cook on high for 18 to 24 hours.
Check water level periodically, more may need to be added. Strain the broth through a strainer and cool. Broth can be used for sipping, or adding to other recipes and soups.
You can store extra broth in glass mason jars in the freezer for future single serve use. Just leave ½ inch headspace in the jar and allow to cool completely before placing in the freezer.

recipes.title: Broccoli Fennel Soup
recipes.notes: (Use the fennel bulb another day to make our Creamy Carrot Fennel Soup)
ingredients: Feathery Tops From 1 Bulb of Fennel, Chopped
instructions: Remove leaves and cut the tough outer layer of the broccoli stems. Chop the broccoli including the stems (discard any woody parts). Set aside.
Saute leeks and garlic in coconut oil in a large stock pot for about 4 minutes or until transparent.
Add the chopped broccoli, the fennel tops, broth and sea salt.
Simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
Puree the mixture in a blender for 2 minutes or until smooth. (If you like your soup chunky, do not blend the entire batch- leave some in the pot and add the blended soup back in).
Add blended mixture back into the stock pot and simmer on low for 10 more minutes.
Garnish with green onions if desired.

recipes.title: Carrot Ginger Halibut Soup
ingredients: 1 1/2 tsp - Ground Ginger (or 1 1/2 Tbsp - Fresh Ginger)
instructions: Melt coconut oil in a med-large saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion until translucent (~8 min).
Add carrots, ginger, broth and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes.

Scoop out about one third of the carrots and onion through a slotted spoon to drain liquid off and transfer to a small bowl. Pour the remaining mixture into a blender, puree, and return to the saucepan. Put the carrots and onions you removed back into the saucepan.
Add halibut and pepper and bring to a boil. Simmer uncovered for 6 more minutes.
Add sea salt to taste and enjoy!

recipes.title: Creamy Carrot Fennel Soup
recipes.notes: (Use the feathery fennel tops another day in our Broccoli Fennel Soup Recipe)
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add the leeks and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the Carrots, Fennel, Broth, Thyme,  Parsley and Salt. Cover and simmer for 35 minutes.
Use an immersion blender or transfer into a blender to puree the soup.
Return the soup to the pot and stir in the chives. Serve immediately or allow to cool and store in a glass jar in the fridge.

recipes.title: Creamy Cauliflower Leek Soup
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add the leeks, celery, garlic, thyme, lemon zest, cauliflower, nutmeg, salt and pepper and cook for 10 minutes or until leeks begin to wilt.
Add the broth and bay leaf and simmer on low, covered, for 30 minutes.
Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth.
Return soup to the pot and simmer for another 10 minutes. Serve garnished with chives.

recipes.title: Creamy Chicken Chowder
ingredients: 1 Large Potato or Rutabaga, Peeled and Chopped
1 Pound Boneless Chicken, Cut into Bite-Sized Cubes
Sea Salt and Pepper to Taste
instructions: In a large soup pot, heat the oil over low-medium heat. Add the leek and cook until soft.
Add the vegetables and spices and  for another 6 minutes, stir regularly.
Add the broth and coconut milk. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the chicken and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Add the arrowroot flour, turn heat up to high and stir until chowder thickens.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.title: Creamy Mushroom Soup
instructions: Melt the coconut oil in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add the garlic, leeks and mushrooms and cook until leeks are soft (about 8-10 minutes).
Pour in the broth and add the thyme, paprika, nutmeg, salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and add coconut milk. Stir well. If you like your soup thicker, slowly stir in small amounts of tapioca starch until you reach desired consistency.

recipes.title: Crockpot Hamburger Soup
instructions: Brown the ground beef in a skillet on medium-low heat, then add to the crockpot.
Add all other ingredients and turn the crockpot on high for 5 hours.

recipes.title: Egg Roll Soup
ingredients: 2 Tbsp - Tapioca Starch or Arrowroot Powder
instructions: Brown the meat in the coconut oil in a skillet until almost browned. Transfer the meat to the slow cooker. Add the remaining ingredients except for the tapioca starch. Cook on low for 5 hours.
Before serving, remove ¼ cup of the liquid from the crockpot, add tapioca starch to the liquid and mix well. Pour it back into the crockpot and stir well to thicken.

recipes.title: Lentil Stew
instructions: Heat the oil in a stock pot over medium heat. Add the onion, carrot and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until soft (about 8 minutes).
Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Add the lentils, paprika, cumin, thyme, salt and pepper. Stir well to incorporate.
Add the broth and potatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to simmer. Cover the pot and simmer for about 50 minutes.

recipes.title: Salmon Chwoder
ingredients: 1 Turnip or Parsnip, Peeled and Chopped
1 Pound Salmon, Skin Removed and Cut into Cubes
Sea Salt and Pepper to Taste
instructions: In a large soup pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the leek and cook until soft. Add the celery, dill and thyme. Toss to coat and heat for 1 minute.
Add the turnip/parsnip and carrots and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add the broth and coconut milk. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 15 minutes.
Add the salmon and arrowroot and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Scallop Chowder
ingredients: 2 cups - Bone Broth (use homemade or Kettle and Fire brand Mushroom Chicken Flavor)
1 - Small Butternut Squash, Peeled, Pitted and Cubed
instructions: Place coconut milk, broth, mushrooms, onion, squash, kelp powder and salt/pepper in a pot. Heat to a boil and then reduce heat to simmer for 10 minutes.
Add scallops and cauliflower, bring back to a boil, and then simmer again another 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add cilantro. Let sit for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup
ingredients: 1 1/2 tsp - Sea Salt, Divided in Half
1 tsp - Ground Pepper, Divided in Half
instructions: Add ingredients listed above with half of the salt and pepper into the crockpot.
Cook on high for 4 hours.
Prior to serving, remove the chicken breasts from the crockpot, shred and season with remaining salt and pepper, and place back in the crockpot.
Stir.

recipes.title: Southern Sweet Potato Soup
ingredients: 2 Large Sweet Potatoes, Peeled and Sliced
instructions: Combine top grouping of ingredients in a 5 qt. or larger crockpot.
Cover and cook on low for 7 hours or until potatoes are tender.  Cool slightly.
Scoop mixture into a blender (as much as will fit).  Blend until smooth and add back into the crockpot.  Repeat and return to the crockpot.  Add almond milk, thyme, honey and nutmeg.  Stir and enjoy!

recipes.title: Squash Soup
recipes.notes: TODO: figure out list in note
ingredients: 1  Butternut Squash, Cut in Half and Baked for 1 Hour at 350 Degrees
instructions: Start by baking the squash.
In a blender, combine cooked squash and the chicken broth.  Cover and blend until smooth.  Set aside.
In a medium saucepan, melt the oil.  Stir in flour, seasonings, salt and pepper.  Add almond milk.  Cook and stir until slightly thickened and bubbly.  Cook 1 minute more.
Stir in vegetable mixture and remaining broth.  Stir well.
